unnormalised: Energy & Utilities: Gas Cylinder Pricing - Oye Hoye, Again?!
normalised: energy and utilities: gas cylinder pricing - oye hoye, again?!

unnormalised: Delhiites, brace yourselves! That monthly gas cylinder refill is about to pinch the pocket a bit more. Sources say Bharat Petroleum, HP, and Indian Oil are likely to announce another hike in LPG prices this week. Already feeling the pressure, na?
normalised: delhiites, brace yourselves! that monthly gas cylinder refill is about to pinch the pocket a bit more. sources say bharat petroleum, H P, and indian oil are likely to announce another hike in L P G prices this week. already feeling the pressure, na?

unnormalised: While the exact figure isn't out yet, insiders suggest a rise of around Rs. 50 per cylinder is probable. This comes on the heels of multiple price increases in recent months. Dr. Sharma from the Indian Institute of Petroleum Economics says global crude oil prices are to blame, but many are pointing fingers at rising operational costs.
normalised: while the exact figure isn't out yet, insiders suggest a rise of around rupees fifty per cylinder is probable. this comes on the heels of multiple price increases in recent months. doctor sharma from the indian institute of petroleum economics says global crude oil prices are to blame, but many are pointing fingers at rising operational costs.

unnormalised: Housewife, Mrs. Gupta from Karol Bagh, says "This is getting ridiculous! How are we supposed to manage the household budget with these constant hikes?". Even the small tea stall owner, Raju, complains his cost per chai served is increasing. With rentals already sky-high at Rs. 10,000 for his 100 sq ft space, this price hike is adding fuel to the fire, literally! Stay tuned for official confirmation.
normalised: housewife, missus gupta from karol bagh, says "this is getting ridiculous! how are we supposed to manage the household budget with these constant hikes?". even the small tea stall owner, raju, complains his cost per chai served is increasing. with rentals already sky-high at rupees ten thousand for his one hundred square feet space, this price hike is adding fuel to the fire, literally! stay tuned for official confirmation.
